attributes.title: The Difference between Black Magic and White Magic
attributes.description:
In this short video, taken from the session 'Manifesting Powers' (http://bit.ly/28QzxS8), Paramahamsa Nithyananda explains about the science of enlightenment and manifesting powers as per Sadha Shiva's revelations.

He makes the statement that 'no power is a power, it is only a confirmation of your oneness with that object'. Paramahamsa Nithyananda gives the example of the wind and of the rain - if you are able to move them, it is not your power over, but your oneness, your friendliness with the wind and the rain. If we believe our power is. Paramahamsa Nithyananda says: 'if you believe when you stop the wind it is power over the wind, you will become arrogant, abusive, egoistic. If you believe if you stop the wind, it is the oneness with the wind, you will have so much of love and friendliness with the wind'. He then continues with a beautiful definition of friendship: people who are exploring deeper beautiful sides of each other continuously are friends.

When we approach the spiritual powers, for instance third eye, we should not have the attitude of conquering it. Unfortunately, our human conditioning is to want to control and manipulate. But manipulation is not manifestation. Exactly there lies the difference between black magic and white magic. Yes, through manipulation you can also have power, but it will always be short lived. The first and foremost requirement for the spiritual powers to express in us beautifully, is the space of friendliness and oneness.
